title: My electric guitar’s B string stop sounding. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Some more information might be helpful. Is it an electronic problem caused by a bad pole piece on a pickup, or is it because of a mechanical problem such as a bad bridge saddle. If the pickup is bad, it is possible that a pole piece lost magnetism this is very unlikely but could happen witk a soldering gun. If the guitar has two pickups, it would play on the other pickup. A problem such a missing bridge saddle leaving the string lying on the fretboard would be obvious. Take the guitar to someone who can diagnose and fix it
